info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 5:53PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN NIAGARA COUNTY THROUGH 645 PM EDT... At 552 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fort Niagara State Park, or 15 miles north of Niagara Falls, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lockport, Newfane, Lewiston, Youngstown, Fort Niagara State Park, Sanborn, Wilson, Cambria Center, Olcott, Ransomville, and Model City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
